abs.documentation: returns absolute value of scalars and vectors.

acos.documentation: returns arccosine of scalars and vectors.

all.documentation: returns true if a boolean scalar or all components of a boolean vector are true.

any.documentation: returns arcsine of scalars and vectors.

atan2.documentation: returns arctangent of scalars and vectors.

atan.documentation: returns arctangent of scalars and vectors.

clip.documentation: kills the current pixel output if any component of the given vector, or the given scalar, is negative

cosh.documentation: returns hyperbolic cosine of scalars and vectors.

cos.documentation: returns cosine of scalars and vectors.

cross.documentation: returns the cross product of two three-component vectors

ddx.documentation: returns approximate partial derivative with respect to window-space X

ddy.documentation: returns approximate partial derivative with respect to window-space Y

degrees.documentation: converts values of scalars and vectors from radians to degrees

determinant.documentation: return the scalar determinant of a square matrix

distance.documentation: return the Euclidean distance between two points

dot.documentation: returns the scalar dot product of two vectors

exp2.documentation: returns the base-2 exponential of scalars and vectors

exp.documentation: returns the base-e exponential of scalars and vectors

faceforward.documentation: returns a normal as-is if a vertex's eye-space position vector points in the opposite direction of a geometric normal, otherwise return the negated version of the normal

findLSB.documentation: return the number of the least significant set bit.

findMSB.documentation: return the number of the most significant bit.

floatToIntBits.documentation: returns the 32-bit integer representation of an IEEE 754 floating-point scalar or vector

floatToRawIntBits.documentation: returns the raw 32-bit integer representation of an IEEE 754 floating-point scalar or vector

floor.documentation: returns largest integer not greater than a scalar or each vector component.

fmod.documentation: returns the remainder of x/y with the same sign as x

frac.documentation: returns the fractional portion of a scalar or each vector component.

frexp.documentation: splits scalars and vectors into normalized fraction and a power of 2

fwidth.documentation: returns sum of approximate window-space partial derivatives magnitudes

intBitsToFloat.documentation: returns the float value corresponding to a given bit represention.of a scalar int value or vector of int values

inverse.documentation: return the inverse matrix of a matrix

isfinite.documentation: test whether or not a scalar or each vector component is a finite value

isinf.documentation: test whether or not a scalar or each vector component is infinite

isnan.documentation: test whether or not a scalar or each vector component is not-a-number

ldexp.documentation: returns x times 2 rained to n

length.documentation: return scalar Euclidean length of a vector

transpose.documentation: returns transpose matrix of a matrix.

trunc.documentation: returns largest integer not greater than a scalar or each vector component.

unpack_2half.documentation: unpacks a single values into different formatted values

unpack_2ushort.documentation: unpacks a single values into different formatted values

unpack_4byte.documentation: unpacks a single values into different formatted values

unpack_4ubyte.documentation: unpacks a single values into different formatted values

UnityObjectToClipPos.documentation: Transforms a point from object space to the cameras clip space in homogeneous coordinates. This is the equivalent of mul(UNITY_MATRIX_MVP, float4(pos, 1.0)), and should be used in its place.

UnityObjectToViewPos.documentation: Transforms a point from object space to view space. This is the equivalent of mul(UNITY_MATRIX_MV, float4(pos, 1.0)).xyz, and should be used in its place.

WorldSpaceViewDir.documentation: Returns world space direction (not normalized) from given object space vertex position towards the camera.

ObjSpaceViewDir.documentation: Returns object space direction (not normalized) from given object space vertex position towards the camera.

ParallaxOffset.documentation: calculates UV offset for parallax normal mapping.
Synopsis: float2 ParallaxOffset (half h, half height, half3 viewDir)

DecodeLightmap.documentation: Decodes color from Unity lightmap (RGBM or dLDR depending on platform).

EncodeFloatRGBA.documentation: Encodes [0..1) range float into RGBA color, for storage in low precision render target.

DecodeFloatRGBA.documentation: Decodes RGBA color into a float.

EncodeFloatRG.documentation: Encodes [0..1) range float into a float2.

EncodeViewNormalStereo.documentation: Encodes view space normal into two numbers in 0..1 range.

DecodeViewNormalStereo.documentation: Decodes view space normal from enc4.xy.

WorldSpaceLightDir.documentation: Computes world space direction (not normalized) to light, given object space vertex position.

ObjSpaceLightDir.documentation: Computes object space direction (not normalized) to light, given object space vertex position.

Shade4PointLights.documentation: Computes illumination from four point lights, with light data tightly packed into vectors. Forward rendering uses this to compute per-vertex lighting.
Synopsis: float3 Shade4PointLights (float4 lightPosX, float4 lightPosY, float4 lightPosZ, float3 lightColor0, float3 lightColor1, float3 lightColor2, float3 lightColor3, float4 lightAttenSq, float3 pos, float3 normal)

ComputeScreenPos.documentation: Computes texture coordinate for doing a screenspace-mapped texture sample. Input is clip space position.

ComputeGrabScreenPos.documentation: Computes texture coordinate for sampling a GrabPass texure. Input is clip space position.

ShadeVertexLights.documentation: Computes illumination from four per-vertex lights and ambient, given object space position & normal.

UnityWorldSpaceViewDir.documentation: Computes world space view direction, from object space position

UnityWorldToClipPos.documentation: Tranforms position from world to homogenous space

UnityViewToClipPos.documentation: Tranforms position from view to homogenous space

UnityWorldToViewPos.documentation: Tranforms position from world to camera space

UnityObjectToWorldDir.documentation: Transforms direction from object to world space

UnityWorldToObjectDir.documentation: Transforms direction from world to object space

UnityObjectToWorldNormal.documentation: Transforms normal from object to world space

UnityWorldSpaceLightDir.documentation: Computes world space light direction, from world space position

TransformViewToProjection.documentation: Transform view space to projection space

Synopsis: UNITY_LIGHT_ATTENUATION(destName, input, worldPos) fixed destName = UNITY_SHADOW_ATTENUATION(input, worldPos)

GetAbsolutePositionWS.documentation: This function return the camera relative position in WS

GetCameraRelativePositionWS.documentation: This function return the camera relative position in WS

TransformObjectToWorldNormal.documentation: Transform Normal Object To World Space

TransformWorldToObjectNormal.documentation: Transform Normal World To Object Space

Synopsis: real3x3 CreateTangentToWorld(real3 normal, real3 tangent, real flipSign)

FastSign.documentation: Returns -1 for negative numbers and 1 for positive numbers
Synopsis: float FastSign(float s, bool ignoreNegZero = true)

Orthonormalize.documentation: Returns the new tangent (the normal is unaffected).

Smoothstep01.documentation: smoothstep that assumes that 'x' lies within the [0, 1] interval.

Smootherstep01.documentation: smoothstep that assumes that 'x' lies within the [0, 1] interval.

Smootherstep.documentation: smoothstep that assumes that 'x' lies within the [0, 1] interval.
Synopsis: real Smootherstep(real a, real b, real t)
float ComputeTextureLOD(float3 duvw_dx, float3 duvw_dy, float3 duvw_dz, float scale)

Linear01DepthFromNear.documentation: Z buffer to linear 0..1 depth (0 at near plane, 1 at far plane)

Does NOT work with orthographic projection.

Linear01Depth.documentation: Z buffer to linear 0..1 depth (0 at camera position, 1 at far plane).
Synopsis: Does NOT correctly handle oblique view frustums.
Does NOT work with orthographic projection.

EncodeLogarithmicDepthGeneralized.documentation: 'z' is the view space Z position (linear depth).
Synopsis: saturate(z) the output of the function to clamp them to the [0, 1] range.

DecodeLogarithmicDepthGeneralized.documentation: 'd' is the logarithmically encoded depth value.
Synopsis: saturate(d) to clamp the output of the function to the [n, f] range.

Synopsis: saturate(d) to clamp the output of the function to the [n, f] range.

ConvertEquiarealToCubemap.documentation: Performs conversion from equiareal map coordinates to Cartesian (DirectX cubemap) ones.

CubemapTexelToDirection.documentation: Convert a normalized cubemap face position into a direction
